attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Many Muslims in the UK feel they require a national holiday to celebrate the Birth of Prophet Muhammad (Peace & Blessings be upon him).

Milad-Un-Nabi is also known as EID to all Muslims.

This is done in many countries, Muslim & Non-Muslim:
AFRICAN: Algeria, Benin, Burkina Faso, Cameroon, Egypt, Eritrea,Ethiopia, Gambia, Guinea, Libya, Mali, Mauritania, Morocco, Niger, Nigeria, Senegal, Sierra Leone, Somalia, Sudan,Tanzania, Tunisia, Togo. MID-EAST: Bahrain, Iran, Iraq, Jordan,Kuwait, Lebanon, Oman, Palestine, Syria, United ArabEmirates/UAE, Yemen. ASIA: Afghanistan, Bangladesh, India, Indonesia, Pakistan, Malaysia, Sri Lanka, Uzbekistan.

FUTURE DATES FOR MILAD:
1) Tuesday 15th February 2011
2) Saturday 4th February 2012
3) Thursday 24th February 2013

Petition 1: 407 signatures - Tahseen Khalid
Petition 2: 282 signatures - Ali Javed
Petition 3: 281 signatures - Ali Javed

From previous petitions we got 970 signatures. For this petiton we need 300 or more to get a holiday.

rejection.details: Your title should be a clear call for action, preferably starting with a verb, and not a name or statement. Also, a Number 10 epetition requires 500 or more signatures to get a response from Government, and does not guarantee the creation of a bank holiday as suggested in your petition.
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
